lov 4/22/2022 10:43 PM
On the assumption that it does possess true virtue tied to it, I think it's a means to some end, and I'm unsure what that end is and therefore can't say on that basis. So I'm viewing this on the scale of society as a unit. Virtue signalling helps society optimize that behaviour easier. Because it's the easiest of the subsets of virtuous behaviours, so there's enough true virtue at net to make it cheaper than incentivizing other forms where the cost to make it visible in order to maximize is higher. Its goodness on the basis of it being a means, where the unknown end is equivalent among the larger set of virtuous behaviours, I think reinforcing that behaviour relative to the others can have both positive and negative effects where different points on soceity's evolution dictates whether it leans more to the positive or negative, or good or bad. My idea here is that virtue signalling allows faster reinforcement, and creates a lot more virtuous acts that allow signalling. And this creates a larger quantity of virtue. But this pushes out the alternative virtues that lack signalling, but may likely be based on longer times until outcome. The latter may be of higher quality and be judged as more good during certain stages of a society, or perhaps not stages of development but rather if society works on a cycle and at certain points, one is better than the other. (edited)

qwerkyscience 4/23/2022 3:45 AM
I’ve sort of written something related for which that concept you linked could be a solution. It was that long term goals are hard to have motivation for because they are usually long term due to involving many steps. The more steps involved, the more incomprehensible it is for us to predict the outcome and success. The more we need to rely on faith. I think adhd are more prone to this. Making other terminal goals allows you to set the goal closer and maybe even with each step towards the main goal

To distinguish physically permissible causal fermion systems, a physical equation has to be specified. The causal fermion systems theory is thus an offering to quantum geometry, as well as to the quantum gravitational approach. In an analogy with the Lagrangian formulation of classical field theory, the physical equations of causal fermion systems are given by the Variation Principle, so-called the principle of causal action. Inspired by the Lagrangian formulation of classical field theory, dynamics in the causal fermion system are described via a variational principle defined as follows. Specifically, the causal fermion system gives rise to spacetime along with further structures generalizing objects such as spinors, metrics, and curvature. Recovered leads to the view that wavefunctions from all the states that are in the run (including sea states) must be considered the fundamental physical objects...
6:58 PM
The picture in physics is that a single causal fermion system describes spacetime along with all of the structures and objects in it (such as the causal structure and metric, the wavefunctions, and the quantum fields). Recovered leads to the idea that the wave functions of all occupied states (including the sea states) should be regarded as the basic physical objects.......The physical picture is that one causal fermion system describes a space-time together with all structures and objects therein (like the causal and the metric structures, wave functions and quantum fields ). The proof is that (a) this theory must be described in terms of quantum fields, (b) that n-point functions in such fields have well-behaved limiting scales over small distances, and (c) there are LOCALIZED a few units away. While most theories in physics are based on real numbers, quantum theory was the first to be expressed in terms of operators acting on a complicated Hilbert space. That is, in terms of the first three principles. The laws of motion can be expressed succinctly as actions in classical electromagnetism, general relativity, and quantum electrodynamics, but perhaps it is not appreciated that also the second law of thermodynamics can be expressed accordingly for the description of evolutionary processes. We also demonstrate how an equation for the universe recently deduced from relativistic Newtonian theories can be deduced in a novel way from quantum field equations, presented in this article. Three-dimensional Spacetime Gravitational metrics, 3-space+3-time dimensions by Espen Gaarder Haug Recently, we proposed a new quantum gravity theory which could be unifying with quantum mechanics. I need to phrase all this in more game theory terms for it to become more articulate. Now, my theory on money. Money is empty, it flows between a network of people. Like the kg, it is a standardized form of measurement. Unlike the kg, it doesn't have a set representation. In the network of people, there's an imaginary ledger of what's owed and there's a scarcity of money to account for this. So it's constantly being moved around as time goes on, borrowing here to cash out there, then doing the same all over. Optimizing while incentivizing the creation of value indefinitely. Money itself doesn't have anything it specifically represents, it represents anything transactionable, or it can even be used representing itself. When it represents itself, that means it is representing the potential of anything transactionable. Imaginary value with the potential to become concrete value.

Eliade 7/20/2022 6:28 AM
It's interesting that you would write something about empirical senses so soon after I'd put it together myself. I'd like to start my criticism with your use of "archetypal": I believe you are using it to mean "impressions that loom large," when the word means "innate, ancestrally descended." Gendered norms, which enter into the planetary draw of "male" and "female" impressions, may seem (without reflection) to be primary qualities; as you understood, however, many norms are simply socially-constructed and so do not count as archetypal. To hold a door open for a woman is a construct, but it is based on the archetypal care-relationship between man and woman. This does not imply a fixed interpretation of archetypes or a determinate expression. In the case of "infantilizing women," many different circumstances have led to an outcome that we may retroactively assess with this label: whether we like it or not, the fact is that this relationship is memetically potent, even among women. Building here, we should not be tempted to believe that all male/female qualities or dispositions are socially-constructed.
1
6:32 AM
The question you highlighted, "If everyone were authentic would we be fucked?" is valuable, but I don't think you ever resolved it. "Is there a most suitable narrative for the proper function of interpersonal relations?" I would be tempted to look for something simple: the more complexity we add to who people can be around others, the more likely people are to disseminate socially and prefer their own company. As you said, predictability is massively important: is there a way to recognize wild or wonderful identities without forcing cognitively impenetrable rituals onto people?

lov 7/25/2022 4:21 AM
This paper examines whether propaganda broadcast over radio helped to change interethnic attitudes in postgenocide Rwanda. We exploit variation in exposure to the government’s radio propaganda due to the mountainous topography of Rwanda. Results of lab-in-the-field experiments show that individuals exposed to government propaganda have lower salience of ethnicity, have increased interethnic trust, and show more willingness to interact face-to-face with members of another ethnic group. Our results suggest that the observed improvement in interethnic behavior is not cosmetic and reflects a deeper change in interethnic attitudes. The findings provide some of the first quantitative evidence that the salience of ethnic identity can be manipulated by governments.

Ego is investment in mental pathways they don’t want to get rid of imo. It’s a conservation and efficiency thing, they’re trying to maintain the validity of their mental frameworks and skills -keep people around them reliant on them, and to try to see how what they invested in could still be relevant and repurposed. It’s conservative cause the brain can’t waste energy. There’s pros and cons to this need for efficiency maybe. Autism and ocd and related disorders are thought to be caused by excessive oxidative stress -maybe they are forced into efficiency? Cornered into the strategy? Synaptic pruning (which is impaired in autism) I can imagine being too energy demanding overall, but it’s the building back that autists can’t afford. (edited)

I think the social defeat arc is psychedelic. You are ostracized from your old social group -all your ties severed and with it all the schemata on how to interact with those people. Knowing you’ll no longer see those people again you gain a ton of new cortical territory to be overwritten for new tasks. All the mental networks you’d invested in for all the nuances in how to interact with them get set to be overwritten, deleted, forgotten and replaced.
